page.title: 15INTERVIEW WITH SCHOOL COOK
page.content: Mrs. Delves is our school cook. She has been at our school for 43 years.She was here during the Second World War. As there was a shortage the headteacher used to weigh out the ingredients every day so that she didn't waste anything!She has seen lots of headteachers at our school - Mrs. Springham is the first lady head.The first canteen to be opened was in the old Wesleyan Sunday School building.The children were marched over there at dinner times.Mrs. Delves had to light coal stoves and collect water in buckets.She had to feed 150 evacuees who had been brought from the big cities to Lanivet. Today the school kitchen is in the main building.Last week a new potato peeler was fitted.School dinners cost 65p each and Mrs. Delves cooks about 30 a day.
